definition: to patronize/to support/to praise/(Internet slang) to like (an online post on Facebook etc)
to approve of/to endorse/(vote) in favor
to praise without cease (idiom); praise sb to high heaven
to praise/to speak highly of/to commend
Songtsen Gampo or Songzain Gambo (604-650) Tibetan emperor, founder of the Tubo 吐蕃 dynasty
Zanhuang county in Shijiazhuang 石家莊|石家庄[Shi2 jia1 zhuang1], Hebei
Zanhuang county in Shijiazhuang 石家莊|石家庄[Shi2 jia1 zhuang1], Hebei

sentences.english: Palmer knows that Drazen is holding Kimberly and wants him dead.
sentences.chinese: 帕默知道德拉贊一夥捉住了金姆，並且想要他的命。

sentences.english: Meanwhile Zamparini has also confirmed for the umpteenth time that Amauri is extremely close to joining Juve.
sentences.chinese: 同時贊帕里尼再次確認阿毛裏離尤文越來越近了。

sentences.english: You love the poem by fasting, praise for the "clear skies icicle."
sentences.chinese: 遊受齋愛其詩，贊爲“晴空冰柱”。

sentences.english: He seems to be friends with DeRozan and Lowry.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎和德羅贊以及洛瑞是朋友。

sentences.english: "Amauri will not score against us, " Zamparini said.
sentences.chinese: “阿毛裏不會對我們取得進球，”贊帕里尼說到。

sentences.english: Jack bursts out the back door of the van and kills the guards.
sentences.chinese: 傑克從車後門闖了出來，殺死了德拉贊父子的護衛們。

sentences.english: The truck was trundling along the escarpment of the Zambesi valley.
sentences.chinese: 卡車沿着贊比西山谷的絕壁緩緩行進。

sentences.english: After work driver Ramzan comes home.
sentences.chinese: 下班後，司機拉姆贊回到家。

sentences.english: Lunzan style evolvement in pre-four history works is closely contacted with the era disputation vogue.
sentences.chinese: 前四史論贊文體演變與時代論議風潮密切相關。

sentences.english: Since it is impossible mission, why he try to do it ? Never quit , just do it. That's the point.
sentences.chinese: 幾乎沒有個橋段是用過的，阿湯哥的那個團隊真心贊。

sentences.english: Someone asked the candidate whether he'd vote to cut our taxes.
sentences.chinese: 有人問侯選人他會投票贊減稅。

sentences.english: Hanshan's poems were prized by Liu Dajie with Superlative, Free and Natural Mood.
sentences.chinese: 寒山詩歌被劉大傑先生贊爲有“高遠空靈的情趣”。

sentences.english: He measures his self-worth by other people's likes.
sentences.chinese: 他用旁人的韋“贊”來衡量他的自我價值。

sentences.english: Karazhan has 14 new soundtracks for different parts of the dungeon.
sentences.chinese: 卡拉贊現在根據區域的不同，加入了14首新的音軌。

sentences.english: Ladies, if you want a man at your feet, wear high heels.
sentences.chinese: 孫儷女兒穿媽媽高跟鞋網友贊小花腳丫可愛。

sentences.english: There are a lot of players who inspire me, some of their are my teammates, like Zambrotta.
sentences.chinese: 我欣賞很多球員，有些是現在的隊友，比如贊布羅塔。

definition: to like (an online post on Weibo, Facebook etc)
to thank/to apologize/to wither (of flowers, leaves etc)/to decline

apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc
to discuss/to comment/to criticize/to judge/to choose (by public appraisal)
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
original poster (in an online forum)/landlord of a building (traditional)
(name of states and dynasties at several different periods)/surname Qi
neat/even/level with/identical/simultaneous/all together/to even sth out
